website_summaries.verdict: Quick load times, excellent Blu-ray image quality, and a generous suite of streaming services make the LG BD550 a solid entry-level Blu-ray player.
pros: Netflix, Vudu, YouTube, Pandora, and CinemaNow streaming
plays music, videos, and pictures off a connected USB drive
relatively quick load times compared with other entry-level Blu-ray players
cons: No DLNA compatibility, so you can't stream digital media from a networked computer
must manually change the output mode to 1080p

customer_reviews.title: not too happy with BD550
customer_reviews.text: I'm an LG fan - have two LG TV's and a BD370 that I am real pleased with. Got the BD550 to work on TV 1 and move the older BD370 to TV2. Unit ships with 1080i as the default resolution, and when it is changed to 1080p the display pops, flashes and eventually the unit powers off. 1080p with the older BD370 works fine on TV1, but not with the BD550, so I know it's not a TV or cable problem. LG customer service suggested I leave it at 720p, but no thanks, I want a machine that dos what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzrob

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is an obsolete product. LG support informed me that this is an outdated product and Amazon was given this to close it out. It does not play newest released and it does not support WIFI. I bought 2 and have asked for return authorization for both. I have bought a Panasonic unit that comes with the WIFI adapter and this worked great out of the box with very good picture and sound quality. Do not consider this unit. Amazon took the product back without any cost to me so Amazon has lived up to expectation in terms of customer support
customer_reviews.author: K. Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful player, network features could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Picture and sound quality are superb. I use the pass through feature for my HDMI connection to the TV so that the audio output goes directly to the digital input of my dolby receiver without extra wiring. Menus are pretty simple and setup is a snap. Cons: Network features are fine theoretically, but the processor in the player is underpowered for this function. There is a tendency to lock up if the internet feature you are using has the slightest delay or glitch in the signal. All in all a great BD Player and the selection of widgets is generous but don't expect the same internet efficiency you would from a PC.
customer_reviews.author: K.  Bassett

customer_reviews.title: In USA and happily viewing  REGION 2 (UK) BLU-RAYs
customer_reviews.text: I love British TV shows but never had any luck when trying to change the REGION CODE on my DVD player to accomodate the out-of-region(UK) DVDs. So when I heard that the LG BLU-RAY player (LG BD550) would play REGION 2(UK) discs w/o any difficulty, and no changing of REGION CODES, I immediately purchased it. I'm happy to report I've viewed my first out-of-region (Singapore) disc without any problem. I watched I LOVE YOU PHILLIP B. MORRIS which has yet to be distributed in the US in either format. Can't wait til I receive my UK version of LIFE ON MARS.
customer_reviews.author: Toast

customer_reviews.title: LG550 Network Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Blu-rays have an occasional stutter. It appears that the player backs up a couple of frames every minute or so. I've tried shutting off all of the features, such as BD live, with no effect. The frame rate settings also make no difference. The stutter does not annoy me much, but drives my wife nuts. The streaming video from Netflix is very useful and easy to use (I'm using a wired FIOS connection), with good but not great video quality. I've seen the same stutter viewing streaming Netflix, but even more so. I chalk up the Netflix artifacts to the challenges of video over the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: rjyarbrough

customer_reviews.title: lg blu ray player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player after reading the positive reviews . Unfortunately, this blu ray player kept skipping and freezing I tried to play Horse War, I don't know why I keep buying blu-ray movies, ( AFTER 2 YEARS!!), if all of them skipped or froze completely all of them brand new movies and never used, maby it is just my luck... I normally when I write reviews I am a 5 star customer but, I am so annoyed with this purchase that I bought in May of 2010, that I just had to. And by the way, I would not have the courage to sell it to anyone after knowing this.
customer_reviews.author: M.G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the money
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews of Blue Ray players I chose this one. I didn't need a wireless connection since my router is very close to the player. The picture is superb and having access to the "Netcast" offerings has saved me from being dependent on summer reruns for entertainment. I had a little difficulty getting a lasting handshake with the Internet offerings, but once the networks recognized each other it had been smooth sailing. All the other setups were a breeze. It does a really nice job upconverting DVDs. Certainly an excellent cost/benefit solution for Blue Ray.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: No Cinavia- yay!
customer_reviews.text: Loads very quickly compared to my other BluRay player. Also the 2010 model doesn't have Cinavia copyright protection (the annoying protection that mutes audio on burned discs displaying "Playback not authorized on this device"), unlike my PS4, so my burned DVDs play without concern. I bought a refurbished and arrived quickly for less than a lower quality new player. I don't connect to internet with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joey E. Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Too Bad
customer_reviews.text: I've been an LG fan,this is my second, but probably my last. Had it less than nine months and it's worked great, but now it's: 1. giving disc error messages on playable SD DVD's 2. not accepting the latest firmware update. I was able to update the machine with usb, not the internet, (which for some reason the first customer service rep did not mention as a fix), but it didn't fix the disc error problem, which apparently is a mis-aligned laser. LG Service says to send the unit it and pay $70 to fix it. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: RedRocker

customer_reviews.title: I am happy!
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason I bought the machine is to access Netflix movies on demand. It does what it is supposed to do and as far as I know it does it as well as can be done. You can review your Netflix queue, rate movies and delete movies with the player. I have also played a few DVD's (though not Blu-Ray) and as far as I can tell does it as well as my other 2 DVD players. I have used the player for 6 weeks and have had no problems. The price was right, too! Today, I give it a thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Not a good design, just a piece of junk! The first unit I got would not play a DVD at all - just showed DISC ERROR. I unfortunately tried a second one. It seemed to work OK until I got to the second half of the movie. It would not play ANY second layer portions of any DVDs. My $25 Walmart unit plays these DVDs fine! Two out of two failures! (Not going to try for a third.)
customer_reviews.author: Gator

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 9 Months
customer_reviews.text: The door that is in front of the DVD tray now hangs offkilter, no longer closing fully. Purchased back in January 2011, so I called LG. Apparently the parts are under a 1-year warranty, but labor is only under warranty for 90 days. To get it fixed I would need to pay $69 for labor! I haven't played Blu-ray movies on it, but with regular DVDs I have noticed that it hesitates slightly before reacting. Ex. If I push "Menu" it will not smoothly transition to the menu screen but instead play sound for about a second while the screen pauses before transitioning to the menu screen. For the price I am highly disappointed in the quality and warranty period!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome except
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great, and was super easy to set up. My only complaint is no digital optical audio out. The unit does have digital coaxial audio out, but my receiver does not, so I ended up using regular white and red audio cables. HDMI up the the TV works, the picture quality is awesome, and the main reason I got this player (Netflix) is super fast and amazing, but I still feel a bit ghetto being forced to use the classic audio cables. Otherwise, this unit for this price would be 5 bright stars.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: Died just shy of two years
customer_reviews.text: The player worked fine for the first year and a half. I kept the firmware updated via a wired network connection, so everything was current. During the last three to six months (I can't remember exactly) the player stopped playing DVDs (Blu-rays still played). It would give an error message and the tray would open. About a month ago it stopped playing Blu-rays as well. I was hoping that I would get tired of the player and upgrade to a new one with new features instead of having the player break.
customer_reviews.author: S. Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: Great value and High Performing product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Blu-Ray Disc Player for almost 6 years and it has always performed perfectly. This was a great value for the quality of product. I could not expect anything more from this type of product. It does just what it is supposed to and never has any problems. I like the streamlined appearance as it fits perfectly with my other electronics. I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren L.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this LG Blu-Ray player because wanted to have all rooms playing in high def and migrate my Netflix plan to Blu-Ray. It never worked perfectly, and the first discs had to be inserted two or three times before the player accepted they were OK. Now, it doesn't read anything, not even DVDs. The online services work OK. The pre-rebranding Goldstar quality shining through. Not buying LG products for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray player if it works
customer_reviews.text: I had this player for about 20 days and watched mostly DVDs. The picture quality is great and I could set it up pretty fast without the manual. However it stopped playing the DVDs all of a sudden. I tried multiple DVDs which we previously watched on this player, they all stopped working too. Tried resetting the POWER/cord but still wouldn't work. However it still plays my old audio CDs. The LG customer support couldn't help me fix it. So I am returning this unit for a replacement. I have given 4 stars because when it worked, the picture quality was great. I might change the rating if the second unit that I get is also defective..
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Good player but...
customer_reviews.text: It is a good player most of the time but occasionally it will start slipping in audio and the picture messes up but if I hit the stop button then press play it fixes it. So far that seems to be my only problem
customer_reviews.author: CSISiddle3

customer_reviews.title: Netflix Streaming Problems
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this item for purchase. The LG BD550 has a flaw in the unit where it has difficulty streaming video. If you are looking to subscribe to Netflix, VUDU, etc. look for another unit. I am technically proficient and spent several hours (including a very slow firmware update session) trying to resolve the problem. It had a dedicated cable modem internet connection with excellent bandwidth. LG support blames Netflix. But, Netflix streaming worked without problems on other configurations in my home. I hope this helps you in your shopping decision and motivates LG into creating a viable resolution to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: max c finch jr

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, ok software
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this player for 6 months now. The sound and quality are good. The device is sleek and looks great. The software, however, is just ok. Navigation can be a bit iffy trying to load, go to the menu, move through discs. The fast-forward is SUPER slow, which is so annoying while trying to get to a specific spot in the disc. In 6 months, hasn't really skipped much and we haven't had any major problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: rg-s

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not generally very tech savvy but I love this blue-ray player. I use it primarily for Netflix. The only negative is that you cannot search ALL of Netflix play instantly from your TV (although Netflix does give you several categories based on your preferences) I've found it easiest to set up a "play instantly queue" and use that list. I've also used this a few times to play DVDs and the quality was good (sound and video).
customer_reviews.author: Bells

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second blu-ray player to my PS3. It works, but the interface is really poor. It moves slowly and has an odd background. I feel ashamed that I bought it when I turn it on and see the background. I don't know if it was the cheapest blu-ray player available but I wouldn't brag to anyone that I own it. I get the same ashamed feeling after I eat Taco Bell.
customer_reviews.author: Insightful Commentator

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about a month and so far it works great. The picture is outstanding and the sound is great. It is responsive and easy to use. we have an LG tv also and when we turn on the DVD player it automatically turns the tv on, great feature. Our 7 year old even knows how to work it. It works better than the Toshiba blu-ray we have. We recommend it and for the price it is hard to pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Why speed more??
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a machine that loaded quickly and had a streaming conection. I loads soooo fast that you won't beleive it.My 1st machine was just the oposite. Picture/sound quality is excelent. I didn't want wireless streaming so this was perfect for me. Connection is 1080p quality.I did have to upgrade to a higher bandwidth but it really paid off. I highly recommend this unit. I would have given it a 5 but I have not needed to used CS or have had it that long.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Blu-Ray
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get rid of my satellite/cable tv and was hoping to substitute all the online viewing with this player. I already have a netflix account and decided to see their streaming. Setting netflix up was easy. The first show I streamed was 4:3 and I thought that all shows, if not HD streaming, were going to be 4:3. I tried others, and was relieved that even though they aren't HD, they can still be wide screen. The player has decent load times, but can be touchy. I need to clean the disc before watching to ensure the movie doesn't freeze. Overall, I'm happy to be saving a $70 monthly bill and always have something to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-talented BluRay
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received wouldn't play BluRays, even after two firmware updates. Exchanged it for a new one and it works like a charm. Great BluRay player at a great price and the set up couldn't get any easier. Just love that I can get to my Pandora and Netflix accounts through my BluRay player now. The onscreen interface is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amy CC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the refurbished bluray back in Jan. Works great. The set up was really quick. I stream the netflix through clear, I use pandora, and I use the YouTube feature and it works great. Never had a problem with it. Must say, this bluray is pretty simple (not as fancy as other blurays, and not as advanced as some), but it works great for me. Would definitely recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: cooper

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Blu-ray player back in December and it's been superb. It plays DVDs and Blu-ray discs flawlessly. The player connects to Netflix, however it does not allow you to search; you can sort a small selection of films by category, or your Instant Queue, but there is no on-screen keyboard for searching a specific title. This is a minor qualm. Note: This player does not connect to a wireless network. You'll need to have an Ethernet cable for any type of internet streaming with Netflix or other services. You will also need a HDMI male-to-male cable to connect to your television.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hollen

customer_reviews.title: Love this DVD player
customer_reviews.text: I have this Blu Ray player and I love it. The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because of the first firmware update that took about an hour. When a new firmware was available it only took 5 minutes. Youtube app is weird because when you sign in you cant view your subscriptions. I believe only new videos from your subscriptions. It does have a search function which is a plus. Netflix is easy to use although it lacks a search option. Pandora and Divx TV worked flawlessly too.
customer_reviews.author: DA maN

customer_reviews.title: simple, cheap and works great
customer_reviews.text: this is a great little player. does it have all the different IPtv options no, but it has netflix and youtube and that's all that i cared about. i also have a tivo premiere but i prefer the UI on the LG for netflix. it plays dvds very well also in addition to playing every single bluray i've thrown at it, this includes rentals i've gotten which have been in less than amazing condition. i've had the device for about 5months. when i first got it i couldn't get the netflix to work properly but 5min with LG support and the problem was fixed. for a sub $150 simple Bluray player you can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Rahul G

customer_reviews.title: Great!...except for the skipping.
customer_reviews.text: This blu-ray player works fine at first. Fair price and everything. The picture quality is great. BUT.....halfway through ANY blu-ray movie it starts to skip, freeze, and overall FAIL. I tested the player with 2 separate NEWLY packaged blu-ray and boh had the same problems. A friend came over to watch Avatar and it was embarrising when it froze at LEAST 7 tiems during the film. Plus add that this player does not even come with an optical audio out port and yourleft with something not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Theshipster

customer_reviews.title: I guess you get what you pay for . . .
customer_reviews.text: This was a very cheap DVD player. I have had it for a year and a half and it is really slow. Sometimes it won't connect to the internet. These days, it is just not working very well after less that two years. I am constantly having to turn if and back on again to get it working again. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a BD550 and "updated" the firmware as requested by the machine. After that the unit became a brick for replaying BR discs. DVD no problem. The customer service waas horrible! After talking with 2 representatives, they each promised to send me CD that would revert the unit to factory settings. (not sure why they couldn't post the software or email it) After 3 weeks, it hadn't arrived. Another call to LG revealed that my request was denied! No explanation, no contact, nothing. I would not buy this or any other product from this company. How do I give this product no stars?
customer_reviews.author: rbaxter

customer_reviews.title: Rarely get through a disc
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my first blu ray player. I have played everything from blu rays to standard discs, both new and used condition. This player will rarely play a disc from start to finish without some sort of a hiccup or an all out freeze. Very frustrating. It's going back to Amazon and I really don't recommend this player unless you are playing a brand-new disc every single time.
customer_reviews.author: atvkilla

customer_reviews.title: Great budget Blu Ray player!
customer_reviews.text: The BD550 is an entry level LG player that offers quite a bit. It plays back DVD & Blu Ray just fine. For extras I was primarily interested in accessing my Netflix account so I could stream movies, and the service works great with the BD550. So far I have no complaints and am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: datarush

customer_reviews.title: Only used for short time
customer_reviews.text: Price was right but LG had problem in 2010 with firmware so it was not a great experience. Then, steaming put the player on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: L L

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu Ray
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to use this much but my first impression is very positive. The resolution is great and the Netflix, Picasa, etc features are really pretty neat. It's also very small and very fast, unlike my main Blu Ray player. I may actually swap them out one of these days. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gtamu

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality and great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and loved it so much I bought one for my father and gave to him for Christmas. It is a great blu-ray player for the price and is even better with an ethernet cable. Now He can use it for pandora, netflix, hulu, weathercast, and youtube. This is a steal for the price. No problems so far!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Twhitebird

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The unit lacks TOSLINK (digital optical port) so I had to rearrange my cabling to add a digital coaxial cable (minus 1 star for ease of use). Other than that, installation & software update was a snap (mine is hard-wired to the Internet). Registration for Netflix was easy. For audio I am using an older Onkyo SR702. When comparing DVD to Blu Ray audio, the Blu Ray audio makes the DVD audio sound like an old VHS tape. The boot up time is not excessive. This is my third attempt to find a Blu Ray player I don't have to struggle with. I'm keeping this one...
customer_reviews.author: Mikë

customer_reviews.title: On Its Way Back To Amazon
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to update the firmware for about 2 hours to no avail (even after trying the USB and CD method as well) I came to discover that the player does not support .mkv or .avi playback. The other models like the 570 and 590 do but not the 550!? Even though there is a video playback option for USB devices nothing will play back. Also, the Netflix movie collection sucks. It is not even the same collection offered by their regular online streaming service. Overall, I was very disappointed with this product. I would not recommend, especially if you are a true techo- or videophile.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Does everything NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: This nicely priced Blu-Ray player is worth every penny. Very inexpensive and does everything. Awesome picture, but has no built in wifi (if you need it and your tv doesn't have wifi get the bd570). I have it paired with a 55LE5500. TOTALLY satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Romel H. Gobunsuy

customer_reviews.title: stopped working in a year
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine, but it stopped working about a less than a year ago. It only does power on and off, open and close function... Since it is out of warranty, (purchased from Amazon 5/26/10)I don't know if I need to throw away this crap.. very disappointed with the product quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hyoung Kyun

customer_reviews.title: LG BD550: A Wonderful Blu-Ray Player!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a month now and I'm very impressed. I researched a lot before I bought this one. It's a real bargain for what you get. It was so easy to set it up. The quality is excellent. It loads quickly, too. I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: The player is wonderful, and kicks the crap out of my older Sony. I love the ability to stream all my online content from Netflix and the UI isn't that tough to navigate. Grated I would love to be able to customize the interface a ittle more but overall a great BluRay Player. I've already recommended the player to my rents and siblings. Great Player LG.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Nooning

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Played as expected. I had no issues. Just had to get a remote, but blu ray plays great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hutto

customer_reviews.title: nice player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Blu-Ray player along with an LG 32" TV for a small bedroom. I really can't think of anything I don't like about it. It was easy to set up, has a good remote, it's easy to navigate through programs, and is nice looking and well built. I also have a Panasonic WiFI player in another room and the LG is faster (I compared them both hard wired). I'm very satisfied with the LG and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: 610madison

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: So far this Blu Ray player has been a great value for the price! The only problem I've had is that sometimes with Blu Ray discs, it will start to skip or freeze and the only way to correct the problem is to stop the disc, eject it and then restart it. This was a problem very early dvd players used to have too so I'm not surprised by this, but it does get to be annoying sometimes. Other than that, I have no problem with this for what I paid for it :)
customer_reviews.author: N. Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed after 6-8 months
customer_reviews.text: I have changed my review after using this for 6-8 months because it just stopped streaming Netflix Customer service tried to help but it will not update the driver and so not sure if that is the problem but i had to go back to using the WI console to stream from Netflix
customer_reviews.author: Mita N. Raval

customer_reviews.title: BLU-RAY DVD PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: WORK JUST AS IT SHOULD.GREAT DVD PLAYER PRICE WAS JUST RIGHT.MY FRIEND HAD A OLDER MODEL,WHICH WAS MADE IN 2010 AND IT WORKED FINE,SO I GOT THE SAME MODEL.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing DVD
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love this Blu-Ray DVD player. But it's more than just a DVD player. We actually use it's internet connection the most with Netflix and Vudu HD rentals as well as the pandora feature. It's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: mg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product - But needs WiFi
customer_reviews.text: This was my first BluRay player. I love the Net Cast web applications. I am actually ditching the cable company and watching only NetFlix and YouTube now. I only wish that this model had wifi capabilities. However LG does make other models that do.
customer_reviews.author: dw9098

customer_reviews.title: Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: Great blue-ray player. We watch a lot of movies and streaming netflix and this blue-ray player works great. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara C

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have primarily used this to connect with NetFlix and have enjoyed the ease of use so far. The set-up was easy although it had to download several driver updates which it did automatically.
customer_reviews.author: CRogers

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to view Netflix and to upgrade my old DVD player. It works perfectly so far. I've only been using it for a couple of weeks though and it is too early to review for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Castle

customer_reviews.title: the best blu ray i ever own
customer_reviews.text: this is the best blu ray. I used to have the sony bd s300. then recently i purchased the samsung net blu ray. it so complex to set and sound quality is not good. this is supper fast to load blu ray. easy to set up. picture and sound quality is exceptional. i love it and i would recommended to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Asif Sadiq

customer_reviews.title: Don't received wireless internet
customer_reviews.text: This model BD550 doesn't have capability to received wireless internet. I'm technician and solved it, using HDMI cable from my laptop and Windows 7 bridge capability. In the other hand you can only Access predefined internet web pages using it's own navigator.
customer_reviews.author: Paperless Office

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last... (in this world what does?)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2011, 3 years later I am shopping for a new one because it has a hard time doing what it was created for which is playing blu ray discs. DVDs - no problem. Blu Rays - inconsistent at first and now its a large paper weight. I bought 2 cleaning kits which helped i guess for the very short term. There is probably a better one out there. One that might last 5 years haha.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Auld

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great, price is great, and it is easy to use. The only downfall is that the HDMI cord brings the sound to the tv and the entertainment system. Because of that there is an echo unless the tv is muted while watching videos. As long as you remember to mute the tv you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent product for the $$
customer_reviews.text: [...]so easy to hook up since i have an LG lcd, so i can use one remote. looks great, sounds great hooked up to my home theater. defenitely keeping the LG brand on my top choice list!
customer_reviews.author: Javier Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features for the price
customer_reviews.text: This device far exceeded my expectations for it's price point. Streaming media from Netflix, Pandora, Vudu, and Napster along with Bluray disk capability made this the perfect unit to add to our home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great. If I have any complaints, it would be the time it takes to load a Blu-Ray. You can almost fall asleep waiting for it to load. Other than that one issue I find the player a nice addition to my Home Theater system.
customer_reviews.author: TwinCamMan

customer_reviews.title: LG BD550
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very pleased with this player until bluray discs would just stop mid-movie and the screen would go gray. There was no response to remote or on-device inputs. The only solution was turn off the player and restart the movie. It didn't happen for every movie, but enough to make me not want to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: The Rubys

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product like anything with the name LG on it. If you need a blu ray player and especially have Netflix like we do this is exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Lots of new options on the second TV
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an ancient CRT TV w/ a cheap LCD so decided to add a network connected BluRay player for more HD content. Chose the BD550 as I had local Ethernet connectivity, and this was the first model in their current lineup that had Netflix. Works GREAT. Plug the HDMI and the Ethernet and everything works outa the box. Slight pain in upgrading the firmware via the menus, umptyzillionth time was the charm. Great price on the unit, free shipping, what's not to like!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin J. McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Blue ray
customer_reviews.text: Always reliable LG delivers great performance and easy to use. Great value for the price,can't beat that! User friendly and no complications.
customer_reviews.author: Mouvielle Caro

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: this blue ray play is great good shipping small and does real good with the online netflix style playing plays just about any thing you can think of
customer_reviews.author: C. cassiday

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bluray in order to avoid Cinavia. I have tried it and I like this bluray. No compliants
customer_reviews.author: Israel Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: LG Bluray....good to go.
customer_reviews.text: This was very simplistic, you can use the buttons of the remote just like on the DVD player, it's very responsive and quick. It comes with the hookups to hook it straight to your TV. If you would like to hook it up via HD however you will have to buy the additional hookups. But I have to say that the regular hook ups look just fine! Nice price. I've always had good luck with LG products.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about a week ago and, so far, I have been very happy with it. The only thing that this one does not have is a tv tunner, but it is not a big deal. The internet hookup is super easy and no technical skills are required to have it all connected. Good product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Factory Refurbished In Like New Condition.
customer_reviews.text: This item was exactly like described. It arrived in Like New condition with all accessories sealed in package. Months later the unit is still playing as good as day one.
customer_reviews.author: Darien M. Silas

customer_reviews.title: LG BD550 Network Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: This item was deliver promply and was packaged very well. I am very satisfied with this Blu-ray Disc Player, it is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great Player with USB
customer_reviews.text: I love this bluray player. It will store tons of music and videos. You can use the USB port to watch movies play music or pictures. It will play .AVI movies and lets you save them to the hard drive. Not to mention the Netflix, But i wish it had Hulu. It also lets you play stuff right from your computer wirelessly or with cable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of hardware.  Interface, not so much
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Quality of hardware is good, slim design CONS: User interface is too simplified, Netflix interface sucks with its lack of search by name
customer_reviews.author: Jaska

customer_reviews.title: Great DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product, loads quickly and simple to use. Recommend you update the software before actually playing to minimize any potential issues. If you already use an Ethernet cable to access internet, this is a great player for the money and non wireless application.
customer_reviews.author: James Douglas

customer_reviews.title: migre
customer_reviews.text: I bought blue-ray DVD-player for combined work with HDTV. Both items are LG-products. Their quality is extremely high and their connections are good organized. I enjoy using this set.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Reynberg

customer_reviews.title: LG does it again
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an excellent product. As soon as I tried it I ordered a second unit for downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Leinad

customer_reviews.title: The future of entertainment?  OUTDATED!!
customer_reviews.text: So LG states "This is the future of entertainment" with regards to the Netcast app. Did you know, they are no longer supporting this? Well, they will provide bug-fixes, but NO NEW APPS. How can that be the FUTURE, if there will be no further development? Their solution? Go purchase their new 'smart box' for an additional $100... you will NEVER need to upgrade it. Sure... Netcast was the future, now its their smart box... After purchasing this Blu-ray player, and two of their TV's with Netcast (the most recent one in February 2011), and being told Netcast is DONE... Will I ever purchase another LG product? No way.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Elster

customer_reviews.title: Great starter Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player in order to stream netflix to my television. For my purposes, it is great! It's easy to set up, easy to use, and not complicated for the non-tech savy user. It has worked well for the month that I have had it. I recommend it for someone who wants to easily stream netflix.
customer_reviews.author: teacher647

customer_reviews.title: Great blueray player
customer_reviews.text: Great blueray player. I love the web apps and use Netflix all the time. Just remember to do the software upgrade when you open the box and it works like a champ. I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: tpkethley

customer_reviews.title: Best addition to my home entertainment system
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality and sound quality are perfect, but if you are only using this as a Blu-ray player, then you are wasting half of its potential. This player has a ton of online viewing features, which I use more that the player itself. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryn

customer_reviews.title: LG better than Sony
customer_reviews.text: I Ordered a Sony that did not work properly,after using there instant messaging help line for nearly two hours. I sent it back. Ordered this LG, Pluged it in and followed the simple instructions on the screen or in the single page setup manual we where watching a movie streaming from Netflix in less than 15 minutes.LOVE IT !!!
customer_reviews.author: TDS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Choice - Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, the cost vs benefits,it's working perfectly. It Arrived in perfect condition and honest seller. I am very satisfied...Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Leandro Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Product Has Glitches
customer_reviews.text: I like the player but it has a few design problems. When the unit powers off, if you have a DVD in the unit, the door will open to eject the disk. If you have the player installed in a cabinet, the DVD tray door opens and hits your cabinet door. It will continue to do this until the lazer head of the DVD player is damaged if you don't take the DVD out and then turn the DVD player off.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: Junk number 2
customer_reviews.text: The first one never worked so I returned it. This one worked for one movie then we didn't watch it again for awhile and when I put a movie it made lot of noise and wouldn't work. Now the return is up so I will just throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Stopped playing discs a week after installation
customer_reviews.text: Came free with an LG TV from Amazon. Not the model I wanted. I wanted the 590. This has interesting net features, but again, it will no longer play a disc. Every disc you put in brings up an error message and it spits out the tray. Obviously I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a BluRay player so I have nothing to compare this player to. That being said, the LG BD550 has provided a very positive experience to date. Does everything it says intuitively and with quality.
customer_reviews.author: Valsuka

customer_reviews.title: all fine
customer_reviews.text: all fine the product arrived on time, I am happy with the purchase I can recommend it, thank you very much
customer_reviews.author: aristed

customer_reviews.title: I am now using Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Used the free month of netflix and love it. Would buy a wifi version if not going near your router.
customer_reviews.author: BamaMBA93

customer_reviews.title: Blu-ray disc player
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this player for several months now and it has proformed at a very high level all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mack

customer_reviews.title: Great little player. Web ready a plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one over a year ago. It has been working great. I enjoy watching my movies on the big flat screen. The web features are very nice. I live stream netflix. It is very convenient and no lag time. There was a month or so when the system tried to update the softeware and failed. I didn't have time to call LG but obviously they corrected the issue. I have no problem with the update now. One little issue, the player does not remeber when the disc was stopped last. So, after each time you stop and eject the disc, the next time it will play from the beginning. You can't beat the price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Wong

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 of these - and all 3 went back to Amazon (one more reason for dealing with Amazon). It played SD videos OK, but started and stopped on blu-ray videos. LG product support said a software "update" would fix the problem - it didn't. Compatibility shouldn't have been a problem, since it was cabled to a brand new LG LED LCD.
customer_reviews.author: chefg

customer_reviews.title: Good product for price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good player for the price. It was easy to install. I've had it for over a month now with no problems. I can't tell any difference between blu-ray movies and DVD movies so far, but maybe it makes a difference with HDTVs that are larger than 32". At least the player plays both.
customer_reviews.author: Twittmeier

customer_reviews.title: awesome player fast loading best player ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my review of the BD550 from LG and i give it my pros and cons and my past experience with dvd and hd dvd players to compare it to.
customer_reviews.author: Ilovemymac

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For around $100, you get an excellent blue-ray player with access to Netflix. If you can connect to the internet with a cable and you don't need Wi-Fi, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Player but needs optical out.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for in a Blue Ray player. I like the online content and the only addition I would suggest would be Facebook or twitter would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Love it highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Fast service brand new. Hasn't skipped on me yet. Makes dvd look better. Had all ports that it says it has including USB. Netflix is just great and for the price u can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Metalgearstud

customer_reviews.title: great dvd for the price
customer_reviews.text: i am very happy with this blu-ray, great picture and good price.this is replacing my old dvd player thats a upconvert that i paid almost $200 for it and its not even close to this new lg for less than $100.. great deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: So far it's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this four months ago and while I'm no expert on Blu-ray disk players, so far, for my needs, its perfect. Easy to use and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Melgar

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Loads quick. Great Picture. I hooked it up to a LAN line to my router. Streams netflix great. Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.author: TDub

customer_reviews.title: blue ray
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is working fine and good, but design is not good and price is higher than other website and store. also, this is from south america so you can not use north america made DVD. check carefully. Blue ray play fine.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

product_meta.title: LG BD550 Network Blu-ray Disc Player (2010 Model)
product_meta.description:
BD-P, Netflix HD, YouTube, CinemaNow Ready, BD Live, Advanced Audio, Quick Booting, Instant Tray Open, 1080p up-scaling for DVD, USB Media Host

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 bd550LG Open up a new world of entertainment with LG’s BD550 Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player. Whether it’s the newest Blu-Ray Disc™ or an up-scaled DVD, this makes sure you see it all in the best possible Full HD 1080p video with digital sound. Plus, Internet access brings NetCast™ to your television, letting you stream movies, TV shows and more.



INNOVATIVE FEATURES
Entertainment On Tap
The end of "there’s nothing on." NetCast™ Entertainment Access lets you stream instant, and virtually endless, entertainment from Netflix®, Vudu™, CinemaNow™, Pandora®, YouTube™, Picasa™ and AccuWeather® direct to your TV from the Internet- no computer required. (Learn more)

Enjoy It at It's Best
Make the most of your HDTV. Blu-Ray Disc™ playback delivers exceptional Full 1080p video performance.

Making Old Just Like New
No need to go out and replace your old DVD collection. Even they look better on Blu-Ray. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs with 1080p Up-Scaling via HDMI™ output. (Learn more)

Don’t just hear it. Feel it.
Great picture needs great sound. Get Superior Audio Performance that supports surround sound up to 7.1 channels with Dolby® Digital Plus, Dolby® TrueHD and dts-HD Advanced Digital Out technologies. (Learn more)

Don’t Wait To Watch
A quick-opening tray- ready to play before you hit the couch.

Memories on the big screen
Want to view a highlight reel of the family vacation in the comfort of your living room? USB Media Host lets you view family photos, and listen to music from USB storage devices. (Learn more)

All In One
Having a hard time keeping track of your remotes? With SIMPLINK™, all your LG devices can be controlled with just one remote. (Learn more)




LEARN MORE
Netcast Entertainment
Now buying a Blu-ray player from LG can also mean getting access to virtually endless entertainment and services from the Internet. Want to watch your favorite action film? If you have an LG Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player with NetCast™ Entertainment Access and an Internet connection, select an onscreen service and you’ll be enjoying it in moments. Tapping into virtually endless entertainment from the Internet no longer requires a computer or messy wires. This is the future of entertainment, and it’s available now with LG.

Roxio CinemaNow™
Now Hollywood’s latest hits can be viewed any time you want. With CinemaNow™, LG consumers can get instant access to pay-per-view movies from major studios directly to any LG Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player. Find major release titles, along with broadcast and cable television programs. The entire premium content catalog can be browsed directly and selections can be watched instantly. CinemaNow™ and LG have redefined what can be expected of digitally available entertainment.

Netflix®
Make the most of the extensive offerings on Netflix®. Users with a subscription can sit back and enjoy unlimited instant access to over 12,000 Netflix® movies and TV episodes* streamed directly to their TV set. Most movies and TV episodes appear in standard definition and many selections are not new releases.

Netflix® subscription required and sold separately.

YouTube™
Now you can watch everything on YouTube™ right in your living room. Blu-ray players with NetCast™ give you unlimited, direct access to the millions of Web videos available through YouTube™, whenever you want them. All you need is an active Internet connection. Watch that one fellow making a fool of himself over and over again.

Vudu™
If you want major studio releases in Full HD 1080p and Dolby® Digital Plus sound, Vudu™ is the only place you’ll find it. With 20,000 HD titles available, and 2,000 in Blu-ray-quality HDX format, there’s no better source for streaming HD movies on NetCast™.

Pandora®
Listen to a radio station made just for you. By entering artist or song information, Pandora® will generate a playlist of similar recommendations. Your new favorite song is waiting.

Picasa™
Edit digital photos so they look their best when shared on your television screen, and create galleries and slideshows for easy organization any time you want to enjoy them.

Accuweather®
Get up to the minute weather updates, plus forecast information to help plan ahead.




Standard DVD Up-Scaling
It's not just Blu-ray discs that look great on a Blu-ray player. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs to near full HD picture quality. That means even your older movies and shows look better on an LG Blu-ray player.




Superior Audio Performance
Blu-Ray lets you enjoy the best sound available from your movies and shows. Supports surround sound up to 7.1 channels with Dolby® Digital Plus, Dolby® TrueHD and dts-HD Advanced Digital Out technologies.




USB 2.0 Media Host
Bring your digital library to life on your television with USB 2.0 Media Host. View family photos, watch videos and listen to music from USB storage devices.




SimpLink™
Are your remote controls taking over the living room? Now with SimpLink™, you can easily set up and control all of your HDMI™ connected LG devices with just one remote.
feature_bullets: Blu-ray Disc Player with Pure Audio and Video Performance
Full HD 1080p output via HDMI with Cinema mode at 24 or 60 frames per second USB Media Host
Superior audio performance with 7.1 channels with Dolby Digital Plus & TrueHD & dts-HD
Express reaction startup for instant tray opening

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars322 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
